info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 5:37PM PDT until September 01 at 9:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 930 PM PDT. * At 537 PM PDT, the public reported flash flooding in the Las Vegas Valley. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas, Spring Valley, The Strip, Enterprise, Paradise, Mountains Edge, Southern Highlands, Downtown Las Vegas, Summerlin, Green Valley, Lone Mountain, Anthem, Blue Diamond, East Las Vegas, Sam Boyd Stadium, Aliante, Centennial Hills and Nellis AFB. This includes the following roads... Interstate 15 in Nevada between mile markers 16 and 25. Kyle Canyon Road between mile markers 14 and 21. State Route 161 in Clark County between mile marker 1 and 3. Highway 95 in Clark County near mile marker 93. State Route 167 in Clark County near mile marker 1. State Route 160 in Clark County between mile marker 8 and 26. State Route 159 in Red Rock Canyon between mile marker 1 and 14. This includes the following streams and drainages... Tropicana Wash, Potosi Wash, Colorado River, Las Vegas Wash, Lovell Wash, Duck Creek and Gypsum Wash. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
